newsitem.title: USA: Symantec adds charges to McAfee suit.
newsitem.headline: Symantec adds charges to McAfee suit.

text.p: Symantec Corp on Monday said it has filed a motion to amend its copyright infringement complaint against McAfee Associates, alleging that McAffee copied Symantiec code in its software.
Symantec charges that McAfee has used additional code allegedly copied from Symantec in McAfee products, including its popular software packages VirusScan and PC Medic 97.

Symantec filed the original lawsuit in Santa Clara County on April 23, alleging that McAfee had "knowingly pirated vital software code" from is Norton CrashGuard product, and incorporated it into McAfee's software.
A spokeswoman at McAfee's Santa Clara, Calif. headquarters was not available to comment on the Symantec suit.
Symantec said it has also filed a supplemental motion for a preliminary injunction based on the allegations of newly discovered copying.

A hearing for a preliminary injunction is scheduled for August 29, in which Symantec is requesting the Court to order a stop to the shipment of McAfee products with the infringing code, and to remove all the products that include it from the distribution channel.
